Article.Abstract: MHC tetramers have proven to be powerful reagents for the analysis of MHC class I-restricted T cells. However, generating similarly reliable reagents for MHC class II-restricted T cells has been elusive. Here we evaluated the utility of MHC class II:gamma2aFc multimers, which contain the MHC class II extracellular domains, with or without recombinantly attached peptides, dimerized via a fos-jun leucine zipper and attached to the hinge of murine IgG2a. We have successfully generated 24 multimers in either myeloma or Drosophila melanogaster S2 cells, with an average yield of 7 mg/L. 'Empty' MHC class II:gamma2aFc multimers were effectively used in peptide binding assays. Similar versions that contained recombinantly attached peptides stimulated T cells in an antigen-specific, MHC-restricted manner, and identified antigen-specific nai;ve and effector T cells by flow cytometry. Furthermore, we have successfully used these reagents to stain T cells generated following viral infection. Thus, MHC class II:gamma2aFc multimers are robust and reliable reagents for the analysis of MHC class II-restricted T cells.
Article.ArticleTitle: Reliable generation and use of MHC class II:gamma2aFc multimers for the identification of antigen-specific CD4(+) T cells.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Immunology, St. Jude Children's Research Hospital, 332 N. Lauderdale, Memphis, TN 38105, USA.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;Histocompatibility Antigens Class II;Immunoglobulin Fragments;Recombinant Proteins
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Base Sequence; CD4-Positive T-Lymphocytes(immunology); Drosophila melanogaster; Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(immunology); Female; Flow Cytometry; Histocompatibility Antigens Class II(immunology); Immunoglobulin Fragments(immunology); Influenza A virus(immunology); Male; Mice; Mice, Inbred C57BL; Mice, Transgenic; Molecular Sequence Data; Plasmids(immunology); Recombinant Proteins(immunology); Sendai virus(immunology); Specific Pathogen-Free Organisms; Tumor Cells, Cultured

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Entry in Swissprot is named Lysozyme C precursor, 1,4-beta-N-acetylmuramidase C, Allergen Gal d 4 and Gal d IV, and it includes 18 aa signal peptide.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: 3A9 thymoma cells origin is not detailed, but its TCR specificity is said to be to HEL 52-60 peptide.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: H-2Ak:γ2aFc molecules (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper) with genetically linked epitope are able to stimulate IL-2 production from HEL 52-60 specific CD4+ T cell hybridoma but not from other hybridomas. This and other data support the use of this constructs for the stimulation of epitope specific cells. MHC:γ2Fc-peptide molecules were coated on plates where hybridoma was seeded. CTLL-2 cells were grown in the presence of hybridoma supernatants and assayed for 3H-thymidine incorporation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Naïve epitope-specific-TCR transgenic mice were the source of splenocytes.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: H-2Ak:γ2aFc molecules (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper) with genetically linked epitope are able to stain 3A9 TCR (HEL 52-60 specific) transgenic CD4+ splenocytes, with a sensibility of up to 2% of cells effectively detected. Similar results are obtained with the dimeric form or when a tetrameric molecule is constructed by loading onto Protein A (which has a valency of 2 for Fc binding). This and other data support the use of this constructs for the identification of epitope specific cells.

Actually peptide 48-62 is used in this assay. MHC molecule is a MHC class II:γ2a Fc dimer (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper), purified from S2 Drosophila cells. This assay, where epitope competes the binding of another, biotinilated, IAk binding peptide demonstrates the effective use of this construct for peptide binding assays.

This and other data support the use of this constructs for the stimulation of epitope specific cells. MHCγ2F-peptide molecules were coated on plates where hybridoma was seeded. CTLL-2 cells were grown in the presence of hybridoma supernatants and assayed for 3H-thymidine incorporation.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Actually peptide 284-299 is used in this assay. H-2Ag7:γ2aFc molecules (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper) with genetically linked epitope are able to stimulate IL-2 production from GAD 289-297-specific CD4+ T cell hybridoma but not from other hybridomas. This and other data support the use of this constructs for the stimulation of epitope specific cells. MHC:γ2Fc-peptide molecules were coated on plates where hybridoma was seeded. CTLL-2 cells were grown in the presence of hybridoma supernatants and assayed for 3H-thymidine incorporation.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Actually peptide 207-220 is used in this assay. MHC molecule is a MHC class II:γ2aFc dimer (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper), purified from S2 Drosophila cells. This assay, where free epitope competes the binding of the biotinilated version of it, demonstrates the effective use of this construct for peptide binding assays.

MHC molecule is a MHC class II:γ2aFc dimer (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper), purified from S2 Drosophila cells. This assay, where epitope competes the binding of another, biotinilated IAg7 binding peptide, demonstrates the effective use of this construct for peptide binding assays.

MHC molecule is a MHC class II:γ2aFc dimer (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper), purified from S2 Drosophila cells. Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Naïve AND TCR (Bα11/Vβ3) transgenic mice splenocytes were used for this assay.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: H-2Ek:γ2aFc molecules (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper), purified from S2 Drosophila or myeloma cells and loaded in vitro with epitope are able to stimulate IL-2 production by epitope specific CD4+ cells. This and other data support the use of this constructs for the stimulation of epitope specific cells. Splenocytes were incubated on plates previously coated with peptide loaded MHC molecules. CTLL-2 cells were grown in the presence of culture supernatants and assayed for 3H-thymidine incorporation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Naïve or in vitro activated AND TCR (Bα11/Vβ3) transgenic mice splenocytes were used for this assay.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: H-2Ek:γ2aFc molecules (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper) with genetically linked epitope are able to stain epitope specific ANDT TCR transgenic CD4+ splenocytes, both of naïve and Th1 activated phenotypes, with a sensibility of up to 2% of cells effectively detected. Similar results are obtained with the dimeric form or when a tetrameric molecule is constructed by loading onto Protein A (which has a valency of 2 for Fc binding). This and other data support the use of this constructs for the identification of epitope specific cells.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Naïve AND TCR (Bα11/Vβ3) transgenic mice splenocytes were used for this assay.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: H-2Ek:γ2aFc molecules (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper), with genetically linked epitope are able to stimulate IL-2 production by epitope specific CD4+ cells. This and other data support the use of this constructs for the stimulation of epitope specific cells. Splenocytes were incubated on plates previously coated with peptide loaded MHC molecules. CTLL-2 cells were grown in the presence of culture supernatants and assayed for 3H-thymidine incorporation.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: Several, but not all, Sendai virus strains harbor this exact epitope sequence.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Lung airways cells were collected 10 days post infection.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: H-2Ab:γ2aFc molecules (where 2 MHC molecules are bound to a γ2a Fc domain by Jun-Fos leucine zipper) with genetically linked epitope are able to stain CD4+ lung lymphocytes from Sendai immunized mice but not from Flu infected animals, and the frequency contained is consistent with previous estimates based on intracellualr cytokine staining. This and other data support the use of this constructs for the identification of epitope specific cells.
